channel.title: NYTimes Filtered
channel.description: Filtered news feed based on specified categories.

item.title: How Lee Zeldin Went From Environmental Moderate to Dismantling the E.P.A.
item.description: He once talked about the need to fight climate change. Now, he embraces Elon Musk, lavishes praise on the president and strives to stand out in a MAGA world.
item.author: Lisa Friedman

item.title: Opinion | Actually, A.I. Is Pretty Mid
item.description: A.I. is just what we need in the post-fact era: less research and more predicting what we want to hear.
item.author: Tressie McMillan Cottom

item.title: He’s Dead, but He’s Everybody’s Weapon of Choice
item.description: George Orwell is easy to quote, but what would the iconoclastic British socialist really have thought about politics today?
item.author: Matthew Purdy

item.title: ‘A Tiny Bit of Math’ Might Improve Your Heart Health, Study Suggests
item.description: Your average daily heart rate is a useful metric; so is your daily step count. Combining the two might be even better.
item.author: Matt Richtel

item.title: RFK Jr. Turns to a Discredited Vaccine Researcher for Autism Study
item.description: David Geier has been hired as a senior data analyst at H.H.S. According to several people, he will examine any potential links between vaccines and autism that were debunked long ago.
item.author: Christina Jewett, Emily Baumgaertner Nunn and Sheryl Gay Stolberg
item.content:encoded: Robert F. Kennedy Jr., the health secretary, at the U.S. Capitol in March. Mr. Kennedy has long held that there is a link between certain vaccines and autism.

item.title: Bridges and Tunnels in Colorado Are Helping Animals Commute
item.description: The state has emerged as a leader in building wildlife crossings, which can save animals, money and human lives.
item.author: Catrin Einhorn
